00:00:01:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:01:140000.Dialogue: No, seriously, I think I've finally figured out my problem with women.

00:00:05:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:05:010000.Dialogue: The capybara is the largest member of the rodent family.

00:00:08:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:08:180000.Dialogue: What does that have to do with me and women?

00:00:11:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:11:040000.Dialogue: Nothing. It was a desperate attempt to introduce an alternate topic of conversation.

00:00:15:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:15:140000.Dialogue: My problem is, I don't project confidence. So I decided that the next time I meet a woman I think is attractive, rather than holding back and being cautious, I'm going to assume the mantle of self-assurance.

00:00:27:010000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:27:010000.Dialogue: Oh, yeah? What's that look like?

00:00:32:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:32:100000.Dialogue: Hi. I'm Leonard. And you are beautiful. You pop, sparkle and buzz electric. I'm going to pick you up at 8:00, show you a night you will never forget.

00:00:55:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:55:090000.Dialogue: Good news. I made it onto the team for the new Defense Department laser-equipped surveillance satellite.

00:01:01:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:01:070000.Dialogue: Excuse me. If we're changing topics, I believe I have first dibs with capybara, a rodent the size of a baby hippo.

00:01:11:110000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:11:110000.Dialogue: WOLOWITZ: Thanks. Listen, I have to get a security clearance, so you guys might be hearing from the FBI.

00:01:17:190000.Speaker: Raj
00:01:17:190000.Dialogue: Whoa, whoa, whoa! I don't want to speak to the FBI.

00:01:21:210000.Speaker: Raj
00:01:21:210000.Dialogue: I'm brown and I talk funny.

00:01:24:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:24:170000.Dialogue: They're just doing a background check on me.

00:01:27:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:01:27:020000.Dialogue: It doesn't matter; they'll find a reason to give me a one-way ticket back to Gandhi-ville. By the way, when I say that, it's not offensive.

00:01:34:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:34:030000.Dialogue: Don't be ridiculous, Raj. You're here legally.

00:01:37:120000.Speaker: Raj
00:01:37:120000.Dialogue: Nobody cares. Do you know how long it's been since I got through airport security without being given a colonoscopy?

00:01:43:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:43:170000.Dialogue: You know, I try very hard to make our lunch hours educational and informative, but your insistence on talking about your own lives stymies me at every turn.

00:01:52:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:52:110000.Dialogue: Fine, Sheldon, tell us about your giant rodents.

00:01:55:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:55:190000.Dialogue: No, you squandered your time with me, and the moment has now passed. Feast on your disappointment, much as the capybara feasts on its own waste.

00:02:36:120000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. Raj is reading New Moon.
00:02:36:120000.Speaker: Raj
00:02:36:120000.Dialogue: Oh, Bella, don't you see? Edward's only pushing you away because he loves you. Coming.

00:02:49:190000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. Raj is reading New Moon.
00:02:49:190000.Speaker: Woman at Door

00:02:53:170000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. Raj is reading New Moon.
00:02:53:170000.Speaker: Woman at Door
00:02:53:170000.Dialogue: I'm Special Agent Page, FBI. May I come in?

00:02:59:060000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. Raj is reading New Moon.
00:02:59:060000.Speaker: Woman at Door
00:02:59:060000.Dialogue: I'd like to talk to you about Howard Wolowitz. Oh, thank you. All right. Well, how long have you known Mr. Wolowitz?

00:03:30:080000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. Raj is reading New Moon.
00:03:30:080000.Speaker: Raj

00:03:32:060000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. Raj is reading New Moon.
00:03:32:060000.Speaker: Page
00:03:32:060000.Dialogue: No, thanks. Now, about Mr. Wolowitz...

00:03:35:160000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. Raj is reading New Moon.
00:03:35:160000.Speaker: Raj

00:03:36:230000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. Raj is reading New Moon.
00:03:36:230000.Speaker: Page

00:03:40:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:40:200000.Dialogue: I'm in this country legally, you know.

00:03:42:200000.Speaker: Page
00:03:42:200000.Dialogue: I'm sure you are. Now, to your knowledge, has Mr. Wolowitz ever committed a crime?

00:03:49:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:49:050000.Dialogue: Of course not. I'm here on an H-1B visa, which means I can't be associated in any way with crime or criminal activity. And I'm not.

00:03:56:200000.Speaker: Page
00:03:56:200000.Dialogue: Good. To your knowledge, does Mr. Wolowitz have any foreign contacts?

00:04:01:060000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:01:060000.Dialogue: No, just me. Oh, there it is. Here comes a cavity search.

00:04:08:230000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:08:230000.Dialogue: Please don't send me back to India; it's so crowded! It's like the whole country is one endless Comic-Con, except everybody's wearing the same costume: Indian Guy.

00:04:40:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:40:030000.Dialogue: So, when Howard said the FBI would be contacting me, I was expecting Mulder.

00:04:45:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:45:120000.Dialogue: Glad to see I got Scully.

00:04:48:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:48:230000.Dialogue: Mulder and Scully. X-Files. The truth is out there. Never mind. Uh, so, what would you like to know?

00:04:58:180000.Speaker: Page
00:04:58:180000.Dialogue: You work with Mr. Wolowitz here at the university, correct?

00:05:02:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:02:110000.Dialogue: Yes. Of course, we're in different departments. He's an engineer and I'm an experimental physicist. You know, one of those guys who examines the building blocks of creation and says, "Hello, maker of the universe. I see what you did there. Good one.

00:05:19:070000.Speaker: Page
00:05:19:070000.Dialogue: Right. Now, how would you characterize your relationship with Mr. Wolowitz?

00:05:24:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:24:060000.Dialogue: Good. It's a good relationship. Of course, most of my relationships are good. Probably because I exude confidence. People are drawn to that, you know?

00:05:43:050000.Speaker: Page
00:05:43:050000.Dialogue: Do you know of any groups Mr. Wolowitz is a member of?

00:05:46:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:46:020000.Dialogue: You are beautiful, you know that? You pop, sparkle and buzz electric.

00:05:54:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:54:210000.Dialogue: I'm going to pick you up at 8:00, show you a night you will never forget.

00:06:06:010000.Speaker: Page
00:06:06:010000.Dialogue: Yeah. Can my six-foot-two Navy SEAL husband come with us?

00:06:11:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:11:010000.Dialogue: Is that...? Oh, my, I didn't see the ring with my glasses off, so...

00:06:17:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:17:020000.Dialogue: Look at that, I'm starting to exude.

00:06:23:020000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:06:23:020000.Speaker: Leonard

00:06:24:090000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:06:24:090000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:06:26:160000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:06:26:160000.Speaker: Leonard

00:06:28:150000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:06:28:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:28:150000.Dialogue: I suppose I could if I were asked.

00:06:32:060000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:06:32:060000.Speaker: Leonard

00:06:34:050000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:06:34:050000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:06:37:170000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:06:37:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:37:170000.Dialogue: Why do you have to make things so complicated?

00:06:41:220000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:06:41:220000.Speaker: Page

00:06:43:040000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:06:43:040000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:06:44:020000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:06:44:020000.Speaker: Page

00:06:48:140000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:06:48:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:48:140000.Dialogue: You say you're Special Agent Page, FBI.

00:06:53:180000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:06:53:180000.Speaker: Page

00:06:54:160000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:06:54:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:54:160000.Dialogue: And here is my Justice League membership card.

00:07:02:120000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:07:02:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:02:120000.Dialogue: But that doesn't prove I know Batman.

00:07:04:180000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:07:04:180000.Speaker: Page
00:07:04:180000.Dialogue: I just want to ask you a few questions about Howard Wolowitz.

00:07:09:130000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:07:09:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:09:130000.Dialogue: Oh. All right. I doubt anyone would risk the stiff penalties for impersonating a federal officer just to ask questions about a minor league engineer with an unresolved Oedipal complex.

00:07:23:010000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:07:23:010000.Speaker: Page

00:07:24:010000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:07:24:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:24:010000.Dialogue: For the record, I truly support the FBI in the mission which is expressed through their motto...?

00:07:30:130000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:07:30:130000.Speaker: Page

00:07:33:050000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:07:33:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:33:050000.Dialogue: Correct. Now to business. 18 years ago, I sent the FBI Crime Lab samples from a bag of excrement that had been lit on fire on my front porch...

00:07:45:210000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:07:45:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:45:210000.Dialogue: ...for fingerprinting and DNA analysis. Why haven't I heard back yet?

00:07:51:140000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:07:51:140000.Speaker: Page
00:07:51:140000.Dialogue: Well, the FBI Crime Lab does have a lot on its plate.

00:07:56:040000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:07:56:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:56:040000.Dialogue: That's of little comfort to a nation attempting to scrape burning feces off its shoes.

00:08:01:100000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:08:01:100000.Speaker: Page
00:08:01:100000.Dialogue: Would you mind if we talked about Mr. Wolowitz now?

00:08:04:140000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:08:04:140000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:08:06:230000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:08:06:230000.Speaker: Page
00:08:06:230000.Dialogue: Thank you. Would you characterize him as responsible?

00:08:11:080000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:08:11:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:11:080000.Dialogue: I'm going to answer that with a visual aid.

00:08:16:210000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:08:16:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:16:210000.Dialogue: This is my nine-disc complete Lord of the Rings trilogy Blu-ray set. Mr. Wolowitz borrowed it, damaged plastic retention hub number three...

00:08:31:180000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:08:31:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:31:180000.Dialogue: ...and then returned it to me, hoping I wouldn't notice. Would you characterize that as responsible?

00:08:38:080000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:08:38:080000.Speaker: Page
00:08:38:080000.Dialogue: That's really not the sort of thing we're interested in.

00:08:41:050000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:08:41:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:41:050000.Dialogue: You heard me say Blu-ray, right?

00:08:44:120000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:08:44:120000.Speaker: Page

00:08:46:010000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:08:46:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:46:010000.Dialogue: Very well. Would you be interested in knowing that Mr. Wolowitz once snuck onto my World of Warcraft account and changed the name of a certain level-80 warlock from Sheldor to Smeldor?

00:08:59:180000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:08:59:180000.Speaker: Page
00:08:59:180000.Dialogue: I'm afraid not. Is there anything else?

00:09:03:130000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:09:03:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:03:130000.Dialogue: Is there anything else? Where would you like to start? He refuses to pay fines when he's overdue with books I lend him. He crashed the Mars Rover while attempting to impress a woman. He recommended that I go see the third Matrix movie because it was, and I quote, just as good as the first one. If that's not irresponsible, I don't know what is.

00:09:23:100000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:09:23:100000.Speaker: Page

00:09:31:070000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:09:31:070000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:09:32:210000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:09:32:210000.Speaker: Page

00:09:33:210000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:09:33:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:33:210000.Dialogue: That was actually a poorly chosen example, as it had nothing to do with me.

00:09:38:230000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:09:38:230000.Speaker: Page
00:09:38:230000.Dialogue: Yes, well, let's talk about it anyway.

00:09:41:150000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:09:41:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:41:150000.Dialogue: I don't want to. Not that my disinclination to discuss the topic should be interpreted as evidence of Howard Wolowitz's culpability in the destruction of government property worth millions of dollars.

00:09:52:230000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:09:52:230000.Speaker: Page
00:09:52:230000.Dialogue: Thank you, Dr. Cooper. I think I have all I need.

00:09:55:200000.Scene: The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
00:09:55:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:55:200000.Dialogue: (sighs): Oh, good. I was afraid you were going to fixate on that Mars Rover incident.

00:10:07:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:07:080000.Dialogue: Hey, buddies. Guess who didn't get security clearance to work on the giant space laser?

00:10:13:110000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:13:110000.Dialogue: Apparently, the background interviews didn't go well. You guys wouldn't know anything about that, would you?

00:10:20:080000.Speaker: Raj
00:10:20:080000.Dialogue: Well, actually, I may have gotten a little tipsy when I talked to her.

00:10:24:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:24:230000.Dialogue: And I may have hit on her a little bit.

00:10:27:180000.Speaker: Raj
00:10:27:180000.Dialogue: I may have thrown up rum cake on her shoes.

00:10:31:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:31:070000.Dialogue: I see. Well, it's good to know, when I need you guys, I can always count on you to step up and ruin everything.

00:10:44:000000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:44:000000.Dialogue: To tell you the truth, I thought if anyone was going to screw things up for Howard, it'd be Sheldon.

00:10:47:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:47:230000.Dialogue: Well, your expectations have been subverted. Aha.

00:11:05:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:05:230000.Dialogue: Really? Maybe sleep has met you before.

00:11:09:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:09:210000.Dialogue: Mockery? That's all you have to offer?

00:11:13:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:13:050000.Dialogue: I'm sorry. Why can't you sleep?

00:11:14:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:14:130000.Dialogue: Who knows? I haven't watched any scary movies recently. I'm no longer obsessing over why the predicted mass of the quantum vacuum has little effect on the expansion of the universe. And it's been weeks since I took that accidental sip of Red Bull.

00:11:28:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:28:180000.Dialogue: Did something happen today that's bothering you?

00:11:32:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:32:010000.Dialogue: Well, I did mention the Mars Rover incident to that FBI agent and probably cost Howard his security clearance.

00:11:44:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:44:040000.Dialogue: Interesting. So you're saying my insomnia is caused by a guilty conscience.

00:11:50:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:50:160000.Dialogue: Actually, you don't have insomnia. You're sleeping now.

00:11:56:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:56:230000.Dialogue: Do you have any evidence to support that hypothesis?

00:11:59:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:59:150000.Dialogue: How about that Gorn sitting on the couch?

00:12:06:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:06:030000.Dialogue: That seems fairly conclusive. No, Gorn, no. That's where I sit. Thank you for agreeing to see me, Agent Page.

00:12:19:140000.Speaker: Page
00:12:19:140000.Dialogue: Thank you for filing a complaint with my superior, Dr. Cooper. I understand you want to recant your statement about Howard Wolowitz.

00:12:32:120000.Speaker: Page
00:12:32:120000.Dialogue: Then I'm afraid you can't withdraw it.

00:12:35:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:35:170000.Dialogue: I'm sorry. I don't recall you saying "no backsies."

00:12:42:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:42:170000.Dialogue: Yes. I'd like to offer a laudatory statement about Howard's many excellent qualities that I believe will tip the scales back in his favor. Howard Joel Wolowitz. H is for honesty, of which he has much. O's for outstanding,                     which he is such. W's for witty, he's quick with a joke.                    A's for artistic, his ability...

00:13:01:020000.Speaker: Page
00:13:01:020000.Dialogue: I'm sorry. Dr. Cooper, this matter is already closed.

00:13:06:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:06:090000.Dialogue: But I still have "rd Joel Wolowitz" left to go.

00:13:12:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:12:200000.Dialogue: I don't understand why you people are picking on my friend, Howard, when there are much more serious security threats to pursue. For instance, when I first met Leonard, he was on the verge of giving away rocket secrets to a North Korean spy, and not one agent ever investigated that.

00:13:30:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:30:110000.Dialogue: No, it's a different Leonard. He's... Chinese, red hair, six fingers. Good-bye.

00:13:42:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:42:140000.Dialogue: I think he's eating lunch. Uh, Sheldon, I want you to meet Neil deGrasse Tyson from the Hayden Planetarium in New York.

00:13:49:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:49:050000.Dialogue: I'm quite familiar with Dr. Tyson. He's responsible for the demotion of Pluto from planetary status. I liked Pluto.

00:13:58:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:58:050000.Dialogue: Ergo I do not like you.

00:14:00:210000.Speaker: Dr Tyson
00:14:00:210000.Dialogue: But I actually didn't demote Pluto. That was a vote of the International Astronomical Union.

00:14:05:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:05:050000.Dialogue: If "ifs" and "buts" were candy and nuts, we'd all have a merry Christmas.

00:14:13:220000.Speaker: Dr Tyson
00:14:13:220000.Dialogue: Is that the guy you were telling me about?

00:14:19:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:19:150000.Dialogue: Howard. The person at fault for you not getting a security clearance is me.

00:14:27:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:27:020000.Dialogue: Yes, but before you get upset, I want you to know I went to the FBI and retracted my statement.

00:14:32:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:32:030000.Dialogue: And they were okay with that?

00:14:33:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:33:230000.Dialogue: No. If anything, I made it worse.

00:14:38:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:38:010000.Dialogue: In any case, I have been riddled with guilt, which is causing Gorn-infested REM sleep. So, I'm here now to say I'm sorry.

00:14:47:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:47:040000.Dialogue: Are you kidding me? You've set my career back at least two years, and you think you can make it right with "I'm sorry"?

00:14:56:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:56:090000.Dialogue: I followed the social protocol. I attempted to right the wrong, and when I failed to do so, I delivered a heartfelt apology. Now you say, Apology accepted, and I will offer you a one-time-only high five.

00:15:11:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:11:170000.Dialogue: You're tricking me. It really is, isn't it?

00:15:18:160000.Speaker: Dr Tyson
00:15:18:160000.Dialogue: Dr. Cooper, I just wanted you to know I'm sorry for the role I played in the Pluto matter.

00:15:30:100000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:15:30:100000.Speaker: Penny

00:15:32:020000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:15:32:020000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:15:34:030000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:15:34:030000.Speaker: Penny

00:15:35:030000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:15:35:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:35:030000.Dialogue: I have troubles, Penny. I've come to pour them out to the sympathetic ear of the local barkeep.

00:15:41:160000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:15:41:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:41:160000.Dialogue: You know, they have a really nice bar over at the Olive Garden.

00:15:45:200000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:15:45:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:45:200000.Dialogue: I don't like the Olive Garden. They treat me like family.

00:15:52:010000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:15:52:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:52:010000.Dialogue: Okay, Sheldon. What can I get you?

00:15:54:030000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:15:54:030000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:15:55:090000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:15:55:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:55:090000.Dialogue: Could you be a little more specific?

00:15:57:170000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:15:57:170000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:16:01:140000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:16:01:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:01:140000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, honey. I don't know milliliters.

00:16:03:230000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:16:03:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:03:230000.Dialogue: Ah. Blame President James "Jimmy" Carter. He started America on a path to the metric system but then just gave up. He wonders why he was a one-term president.

00:16:14:150000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:16:14:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:14:150000.Dialogue: Would you say that's about 40 milliliters?

00:16:17:040000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:16:17:040000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:16:20:200000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:16:20:200000.Speaker: Penny

00:16:22:120000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:16:22:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:22:120000.Dialogue: I believe you were about to ask me to choose a cocktail. Fortunately, thanks to computer-savvy alcoholics, there's an app for that. Let's see. Harvey Wallbanger. Eh. Sex on the Beach. I hardly think so.

00:16:38:110000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:16:38:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:38:110000.Dialogue: Rob Roy, Silk Slipper, Mad Hatter. Ooh! I'll have a Rosewater Ricky.

00:16:45:180000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:16:45:180000.Speaker: Penny

00:16:59:190000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:16:59:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:59:190000.Dialogue: Here you go-- one Rosewater Ricky.

00:17:02:110000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:17:02:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:02:110000.Dialogue: That's not how it looks in the picture.

00:17:04:040000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:17:04:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:04:040000.Dialogue: Oh, yeah, you know, every bartender makes it differently. Why don't you give it a try.

00:17:08:130000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:17:08:130000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:17:12:020000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:17:12:020000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:17:14:000000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.

00:17:24:230000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:17:24:230000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:17:29:100000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:17:29:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:29:100000.Dialogue: All right. Sheldon, what's on your mind?

00:17:31:220000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:17:31:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:31:220000.Dialogue: I wronged Howard, and he won't accept my apology.

00:17:35:180000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:17:35:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:35:180000.Dialogue: Oh, right, that. Yes, Leonard told me. Sorry, honey.

00:17:39:020000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:17:39:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:39:020000.Dialogue: Penny, you face failure on a daily basis.

00:17:43:180000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:17:43:180000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:17:45:100000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:17:45:100000.Speaker: Penny

00:17:48:150000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:17:48:150000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:17:53:190000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:17:53:190000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:17:58:220000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:17:58:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:58:220000.Dialogue: Oh, if only there were some way to force Howard to accept my apology so I could escape this miasma of guilt.

00:18:05:060000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:18:05:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:05:060000.Dialogue: You know, sometimes stuff just happens, and there's nothing you can do about it. For example, Lisa Peterson hasn't talked to me since the 11th grade, because no matter how much you apologize, you can't go back and un-dry-hump someone's boyfriend.

00:18:18:060000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:18:18:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:18:060000.Dialogue: I see. You're saying I'm facing Starfleet Academy's unwinnable command scenario: the Kobayashi Maru.

00:18:26:040000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:18:26:040000.Speaker: Penny

00:18:28:150000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:18:28:150000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:18:31:230000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:18:31:230000.Speaker: Penny

00:18:35:080000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:18:35:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:35:080000.Dialogue: Impressive that you know that. It's hard to believe I'm actually having this conversation with you.

00:18:41:130000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:18:41:130000.Speaker: Penny

00:18:44:130000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:18:44:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:44:130000.Dialogue: Kirk beat the Kobayashi Maru by reprogramming the simulator. That's it.

00:18:50:090000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:18:50:090000.Speaker: Penny

00:18:52:110000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:18:52:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:52:110000.Dialogue: What...? Sheldon, you can't reprogram people.

00:18:57:190000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:18:57:190000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:19:01:170000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
00:19:01:170000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:19:18:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:18:040000.Dialogue: Howard, you're feeling better about me today, aren't you?

00:19:22:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:22:130000.Dialogue: Yes, you are. I'm using neurolinguistic programming to modify your thought patterns.

00:19:33:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:33:030000.Dialogue: There's a $9.95 e-book down the drain.

00:19:38:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:38:180000.Dialogue: Oh. Sheldon, you can't fix this with gifts.

00:19:41:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:41:220000.Dialogue: Nevertheless, I've hurt you, and whether you forgive me or not, I want you to have this.

00:19:49:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:49:030000.Dialogue: You're giving me a couch cushion?

00:19:50:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:50:210000.Dialogue: No. The cushion is merely symbolic. I'm giving you my spot on the couch.

00:20:01:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:01:000000.Dialogue: No. I love my mother. My feelings for my spot are much greater.

00:20:08:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:08:150000.Dialogue: It is the singular location in space around which revolves my entire universe. And now it's yours.

00:20:17:090000.Speaker: Raj
00:20:17:090000.Dialogue: Oh, my God, dude. Now you have to forgive him.

00:20:31:190000.Speaker: Raj
00:20:31:190000.Dialogue: I haven't cried like this since Toy Story 3.

00:20:44:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:20:44:230000.Dialogue: I got to tell you, Sheldon, I understand why you chose this spot. I mean, the temperature is good, but there's no draft. I can see the television, but I can still talk to...

00:20:53:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:53:220000.Dialogue: I changed my mind. Get out of my spot.
